==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* The name may derive from {{Lang|''{{w|Yukar|oyna}}''|ain=オィナ}}, which are Ainu {{w|Epic poetry|epics}} about the {{w|kamuy}} that gave rise to humans and their culture.<ref>Kotobank: [https://kotobank.jp/word/%E3%82%AA%E3%82%A4%E3%83%8A-1279886 {{ja|オイナ|rm=oina}}]</ref>
** It may also refer to {{Lang|{{w|Ae-oyna-kamuy}}|ain=アエオィナカムィ|ain_tl=the god whom we pass on in our ''oyna''|ain_lit=we-story-god}}, the ''kamuy'' who is believed to have taught domestic skills to humankind and sometimes referred to as only Oyna-kamuy or Oyna.
